metadata.title: CVE-2022-34485 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Bryce Seager van Dyk and the Mozilla Fuzzing Teamreported potential vulnerabilities present in Firefox 101. Some of thesebugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enougheffort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 102.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
